conclusion: Forces on the ball include weight (mg, vertically downward), electric force (qE, horizontal), and tension (T, along the string).
Resolve tension into components: T sin θ = qE (horizontal) and T cos θ = mg (vertical).
Eliminate T by dividing the two equations: tan θ = (qE)/(mg).
Solve for E: E = (mg/q) · tan θ.
Final result: Uniform-field strength E = (mg/q) tan θ.
